title: Report: Mike Vrabel’s former team was ‘unwilling’ to trade with Patriots
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: The Tennessee Titans reportedly refused to trade with the New England Patriots due to owner Amy Adams Strunk's past tensions with Mike Vrabel.
Strunk remains displeased over Vrabel's exit from Tennessee after a 6-11 season, impacting their willingness to assist his new team.
New England showed interest in Titans' players but made no notable trades before the NFL deadline as Titans dismissed trade talks.

title: Following a career night, Josh Minott isn’t taking his starting role for granted
author: Aidan Buchanan
bullets: Celtics forward Josh Minott scored a career-high 21 points in a 136-107 win against the Wizards.
Minott has impressed since joining Boston from the Timberwolves, averaging 9.1 points in 22.5 minutes per game.
Teammate Jaylen Brown praised Minott's energy, emphasizing his crucial role in the Celtics' defensive efforts.

title: Are the New England Patriots back? Here’s what 200 readers said.
author: Frances Klemm
bullets: Patriots on a six-game win streak; rookie QB Drake Maye gaining attention for potential MVP consideration.
Readers split on team's performance; 43% say 'Yes' they're back, 44% think it's 'Too early to tell'.
Fans express concerns over team's weak schedule and injuries as they approach Tampa Bay matchup.

title: Questions swirl after bus aide allegedly assaults autistic student from Cambridge
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: A substitute bus aide allegedly restrained a non-verbal autistic student, calling him 'the devil' on an NRT vehicle.
The Cambridge family was alerted by DCF about the incident, and video footage confirmed the bus aide's improper conduct.
NRT placed the aide on leave and CPS prohibited the employee from transporting Cambridge students amid ongoing investigations.

title: Patriots owner Robert Kraft named a semifinalist for 2026 Pro Football Hall of Fame Class
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Robert Kraft advances to semifinal round for 2026 Pro Football Hall of Fame in contributor category.
The selection committee will discuss semifinalists on Nov. 11, finalists announced in February and enshrined in August.
Former Patriots coach Bill Belichick also a semifinalist; Kraft faces competition from eight other contributors.

title: Several police officials in Karen Read’s case faced scrutiny or discipline. Where are they now?
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Canton Police Sgt. Sean Goode and Detective Kevin Albert faced disciplinary actions following accusations of misconduct related to Karen Read's case.
Former State Police Trooper Michael Proctor was fired and dropped his appeal against termination after being implicated in misconduct.
State Police Sgt. Yuriy Bukhenik and Detective Lt. Brian Tully faced job transfers and lost vacation days for failing to address inappropriate texts.

title: How Mike Vrabel, Patriots players reacted to lack of moves at trade deadline
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Patriots coach Mike Vrabel confirmed no moves were made at the trade deadline despite exploring options.
Stefon Diggs and Milton Williams emphasized focus on current team and potential future benefits.
Patriots lead AFC East with a 7-2 record, aiming for a playoff spot with an 87% chance according to ESPN.

title: 5 best new restaurant openings and dining updates in Boston (Nov. 6, 2025)
author: Katelyn Umholtz
bullets: Aatma Curry House will open in Brighton in November 2025, featuring unique Indian dishes without traditional options like chicken tikka masala.
Incredible India in Waltham will revamp its bar and menu, retaining its lunch buffet and adding items like panipuri by late 2025.
Maine-based Sea Dog Brewing Co. will open its second Massachusetts location in Lowell, offering craft beers and bar food by February 2026.

title: Lindsay Clancy wants murder trial moved to Boston amid ‘inflammatory’ media coverage
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Lindsay Clancy seeks to move her murder trial from Plymouth County to Boston citing 'inflammatory' media coverage.
Clancy, accused of killing her three children, wants the trial moved to ensure a fair trial away from local bias.
Her lawyer argues that extensive media coverage has jeopardized a fair trial, proposing Suffolk County as the new venue.

title: Rare ‘deep-diving’ whales spotted off Mass. coast
author: Madison Lucchesi
bullets: The New England Aquarium spotted three rare True's beaked whales off Cape Cod in mid-October.
True's whales were seen over the Northeast Canyons and Seamounts Marine National Monument, 130 miles off Cape Cod.
The survey also recorded over 700 marine animals, including seven fin whales and 402 common dolphins.
